page.title: 09LANDSCAPE - RIVER DARENT
page.content: The River Darent, a gently flowing river in the area, is linked with many aspects of life. Its importance, now diminished, goes back to Roman times when the ford provided an ideal crossing point for the road from London to Dover and gave rise to a settlement Darenthford (Dartford). Along side the river in Dartford are the grounds of a private sports club and Central Park providing many general services. The former mill races and channels have been upgraded to take excess water preventing Dartford from flooding. The river winds along the edge of the industrial estate, its only link with industry now being an historical one. Further south the river flows through farmland providing water meadows.Public footpaths give access to the beauty of the countryside and river landscape.
